page.title: 18TREFLYS CHURCH MORFA BYCHAN
page.content: The font in Treflys church has a mediaeval bowl with a round chamfered rim on a modern shaft,and was formerly in St.Catherine's,Criccieth.The chancel has two 17th century chairs. The most unusual find in this church is a chained stone in the chancel,in excellent condition,4'5"long,9"wide and 8"deep,probably 6th century. Reading downwards from a chi-rho monogram in the form of a cross are vertically inscribed Roman capitals, except the'S',which is cursive. 'IACONUS FILI MIN IACIT'.Assumed to be a burial stone,it is one of only seven similar stones in Great Britain. Possibly a church existed in Treflys from the same period.
